result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Michael Kopca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Serve 4 months in the Pepin County Jail commencing April 3, 2015 @ 6:00 p.m. with work release.
AMENDED 04-28-2015:  Court grants furlough requested by defendant for May 16, 2015 for 6 hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Michael Kopca

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Letter from Peter Kopca requesting a furlough for May 16 from Noon to 6 p.m.

Defendant Peter Michael Kopca in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joint recommendation by counsel.  Sentenced to 4 mos. in the PCJ; court costs waived.  Advised of appeal rights; felony conviction prohibitions.
Sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Judge advises defendant of charge/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed and reviewed by the Court with defendant. Judge finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Neither party requesting PSI.  Bond conditions cont'd.  Schedule Sent. Hrg.

Defendant Peter Michael Kopca in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs the court of plea agreement.  Defendant will plead to charge and set Sent. Hrg. for Jan.
State's Witness List
M.R.F. is required to appear on 12/01/2014 @ 9:00 am
R.O. is required to appear on 12/01/2014 @ 9:00 am
M.S. is required to appear on 12/01/2014 @ 9:00 am

Final pre-trial on November 10, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Jury trial on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on December 1, 2014.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for November 10, 2014 at 9:45 a.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than September 5, 2014. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than September 5, 2014, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  Any nonstandard substantive or other JI they anticipate they will request be given by the Court.
9 - 10 (See Order in File)
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Defendant Peter Michael Kopca in court with attorney Susan T Falch.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of count 1 as stated in the Information & max. penalties and advises defendant of constitutional rights.  NGP entered.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Cross by defense counsel.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State files Information with the court.  Defense counsel wishes to proceed with Arraignment.
